Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libnl3
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libnl3 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The libnl3 packages contain a convenience library to simplify using the Linux kernel's Netlink sockets interface for network manipulation. This update fixes the following bug: The NetworkManager tool previously did not properly handle the "no more events available" status when reading kernel events. On systems with large number of interfaces, NetworkManager consequently became unresponsive when synchronizing the tool's status after the kernel started terminating events. With this update, the handling of the "no more events available" status has been fixed, and NetworkManager no longer hangs in the described scenario. (BZ#1181255) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: Support for retrieving and configuring the "IPv6 link local address generation mode" of a link has been added to libnl3. This allows the NetworkManager tool to use the latest kernel features and functionalities. (BZ#1127718) Users of libnl3 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
